title: For Sale:  WWI WWII Model of 1903 US Military Rifle 30.06 Springfield Armory
location: I-30 and I-430, Little Rock, Arkansas
postcontent: Up for sale is an original Model of 1903 Springfield Armory Rifle made in the year 1915, just before US entry into WWI.  The barrel is marked and dated S.A. (Springfield Armory) and the date "4- "  I cannot read the year. The stock has a faint cartouche on the left side that is for what I believe to be FJA "Frank J. Atwood" during WWII as the rifle was probably re-inspected by an arsenal for service after WWI for use in WWII.  There is also a very faint "P" proof marked behind the trigger guard.  The stock on this rifle is an original pre-WWI or WWI original finger groove stock and is quite rare.  The metal is solid but showing some wear to the parkerization.  The bore shows rifling and grooves but has seen some action showing some corrosive ammo use which was standard in WWI with some pitting.  Overall, this is a rare early WWI rifle that has seen some action.  I will do a bill of sale requiring DLN and date of birth of Arkansas residents. I will also accept a Concealed Weapons License number on the bill of sale which would eliminate a DLN and Date of Birth. I will ship the rifle anywhere in the country to an FFL.

title: For Sale:  Arsenal SLR 107 CR with Upgrades
location: Apex, Raleigh / Durham / CH, North Carolina
postcontent:
For sale is a Arsenal SLR 107 CR with a low round count in excellent condition.  I bought this weapon as a home defense gun, but my girlfriend was never really confortable with the AK platform so I switched to a different rifle.  This is a Bulgarian made new production gun with a cold hammer forged barrel and factory side folding stock, nothing but the best.  The 107CR has a gas block with integrated front sight, reducing the swing weight of the AK, making it quicker to target.  It has a faux conical recoil booster that covers up the 16 inch barrel, but if you want to remove the booster I threaded the barrel to accept a muzzle device (standard AK threads).  I changed the sights for meprolight tritium sights, they were installed a year ago so the tritium is very bright.  The weapon has a Solar Tac MFER mag well, which helps speed reloads up considerably by propperly aligning your mags during changes.  I changed out the pistol grip for a US palm grip, which helps you get better leverage on the gun than the standard AK grip to more easily manipulate the weapon.  I also installed a Krebs custom safety lever, which has a bolt hold open notch and allows for one handed manipulation of the safety.  The front forend was replaced with a Russian made grip, which has 1913 rails for adding a light.  I worked very hard to keep the weight down, unloaded this rifle is only 7 and a half pounds, it has very little recoil in firing and is already set up to be the ultimate fighting Kalashnikov.  This is the real deal, not some cheapo WASR with some Tapco crap bolted on to look cool, this gun will carry you through the Apocalypse.

If you would like, I also have a Russian made PK-A sight for sale that I will sell for 250$ in addition to the cost of the rifle.  The gun will come with the original 5 round factory magazine, but if you need more mags with the gun let me know, I have a ton of AK mags of various types and I will cut you a deal on the mags of your choice.

title: For Sale:  Marlin X7VH Bolt Action .223 (XL7 class rifle)
postcontent:
I am selling a Marlin X7VH bolt action .223 bolt action rifle.  It features  short action, 5 shot internal magazine, 26" heavy barrel, pro fire adjustable trigger, black synthetic stock, no sights.  I believe it has a 1 in 9 twist rate barrel.  It prefers heavier bullets 60 grain and up.

It's a black gun and I'm not a photographer, so I'm not posting any pictures because I can't take one of this gun with my cell phone that's worth looking at.  If you search for Marlin XL7 will see what the gun looks like.  Mine has no damage.

I bought the gun new earlier this spring.  I can shoot quarter size groups at 100 yards and 2 - 4 inch groups at 200 yards (heavier bullets shoot better).  

This was done with a 22x Barska scope that's not included with the rifle.  I only mention this because a lot of people at my gun club wouldn't be caught dead shooting with a Barska scope, so this gun might shoot better with a Nikon or Luepold scope.

I would be interested in trading for a marlin .357 lever gun or a ruger 9mm carbine.

title: For Sale:  Rare Mosin MO 91/30 Plus Ammo and Accessories
location: West Winston-Salem, Lewisville Clemmons area, Winston Salem, North Carolina
postcontent:
This is a rare MO (Ministry of Defense) version of the Mosin 91/30 rifle with a Izhevsk hex receiver.  This MO version is double dated 1931/46.  The MO rifles are generally believed to be refurbished military rifles that were cleaned up rebuilt and then given to various Russian security forces for use.  The first date is the original date of manufacture and the second date is the refurbish date.  This means that the MO rifles typically have better finishes on the stock and metal surfaces than typical 91/30 rifles, and this specimen is no exception.  Like most MOs this one has been counter bored to improve accuracy.  This rifle comes with a sling, bayonet, oil can, multi-tool, and some other tools, cleaning rod, plus 200 rounds of 7.62 x 54r ammo.  I only showed a sample of the ammo in the photo, not all of the ammo is shown. 

This rifle has all matching serial numbers (9581).

I've had the rifle head-space checked by a gunsmith, and it passed with no problems.  I'm the original post-import owner, and I have cleaned off the cosmoline and lubricated the rifle, so it is ready to shoot.  I have fired approximately 25 rounds through it and it is a good shooter.  I've got too many of these Russian rifles and so I need to clear out the gun safe.  Here is a chance for a rare Mosin MO with a hex receiver and matching numbers in great shape with all the accessories you need plus ammo.  

I prefer FTF sale in or around the Winston-Salem area.  I'm actually located on the West side of the city, but could meet most any place.  Price is firm.  This is a great deal when you add in the accessories included plus the ammo, plus the rarity of the rifle. 

Please contact me via email.

title: For Sale/Trade:  Beretta 92SB Rare 9mm
postcontent:
The extremely rare 92SB, Initially called the 92S-1, was specifically designed for the USAF (US Air Force) trials (which it won), the model name officially adopted was the 92SB. It included the changes of the 92S, added a firing pin block (thus the addition of the "B" to the name), and relocated the magazine release catch from the bottom of the grip to the lower bottom of the trigger guard.

 The piece is becoming more and more difficult to find especially in good condition.
 The Date code on this handgun indicated it was Manufactured in 1984 but the blueing on this one is as good or better then most of my newer models.

 My handgun comes with the 2 original "Made in Italy" magazines and one extra aftermarket magazine and a soft carry case. 

$600 OBO text REDACTED
